intro: Bejaria imthurnii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. Bejaria imthurnii is native to parts of Africa and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is sometimes considered a weed due to its aggressive growth and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
